petNameAdd:
1) Govt of Assam
    Advocate - D K Deka

acts.act: Protection of children from sexual offence act 2012

business_details.Business: Accused Shri Anjan Manjhi is present.         The Judgment is pronounced and delivered in the open Court. The Judgment is prepared in the separate sheets.        In the result, I find the accused Shri Anjan Manjhi guilty under section 363 of the IPC/ 4 of the POCSO Act and accordingly he is convicted.         On the point of sentence the accused person is heard and to that effect his statement is recorded. Accused person is a young boy of age 22 years who is the only earning member of his family. Learned defence counsel has submitted that the fact of the case demands the accused to be punished leniently. On the other hand, learned public prosecutor has submitted that the accused needs to be punished as per provision of Law. Punishment prescribed in the section 4 of the POCSO Act is un-doubtfully harsh. Punishment prescribed in the section 363 of the IPC is some extend liberal. POCSO Act is a special legislation by which a legislature intends to protect the child from any sort of exploitation. In the instant case the accused took away the victim and kept in the State of Bihar which is far away from the parental house of the victim without keeping any touch with her parental house. Parents of the victim had to spend 30 days without warm touch of their minor daughter. Considering all aspects I do hereby Order the accused Shri Anjan Manjhi to suffer RI of 6 (Six) months for the section 363 of the IPC and RI of 7 (Seven) years and to pay a fine of Rs. 1000/- i/d SI of 2 (Two) months for the section 4 of the POCSO Act. Both sentences will run concurrently. Seized certificates be returned to the victim through informant after due course of time. Let a certified copies of Judgment and order be supplied to the accused person at free of cost. Also send a copy of the Judgment to the leaned District Magistrate, Karbi Anglong, Diphu in terms of the section 365 of the CrPC.          Accordingly this case is disposed on contest.
